Morning friends! I actually despise the texture of chia seeds and hate when the little bubbles get stuck in my teeth. Something that I do is grind them into a powder using the bullet, and then I put into my smoothie. It takes away the slimy texture and there's no tooth residue going on. For those that don't know, chia seeds are a great source of fiber, protein, and omega 3s. Xo

Plant-based Monday is here and we’re featuring one of my faveeee winter vegetables...brussel sprouts! These cuties are in the same family as cabbage (which may explain why they look like mini cabbages) and 1 cup provides over 100% of our vitamin c needs for the day! If you happen to buy the long stalks at the market, you’ll notice they have leaves at the head of the stalk. Don’t throw them away! They’re yummy and can be prepared just like you would kale or collards. Check out the bio link for more cool things about Brussel sprouts + our fave recipes 🤤🤤🤤👩🏽‍🌾👩🏽‍🌾👩🏽‍🌾

My market is ending the season next week, so I already started freezing and preserving veggies that won't be available during the winter season. All you have to do is boil your darker greens for 3 min in water (blanching), then drain em & pour em into a bowl with water and ice (this halts the cooking process and preserves the nutrients in the greens). Drain again and zip lock it up! Lasts up to 6 months ♡

We get so many patients who come to us sad/frustrated/upset that their body doesn't look the same way it did 2, 5, 10 years ago. Life happens y'all. Our metabolism changes, there's hormones, aging, maybe kids...a lot of stuff going on. And there's no reason to panic. Just because we don't have that same shape doesn't mean we're not healthy. That kind of attachment to what was vs what is can create a very unhealthy mindset around what you think you should look like. Take a moment to embrace what your body has become, and practice healthy behaviors that ARE within your control 🥗💃🏾👩🏽‍🌾🏃🏾‍♀️🥙

Did I mention I love Tuscany? I literally had the best time every today at my own personal red wine + dessert wine + olive oil + balsamic vinegar + honey (truffle honey!) + chocolate tasting today (for free). It all took place in this little shop with the owner Stefano, who lost his job in 2007 and opened this store that same year. He makes his own wine and only houses other wines that are made within a 30 kilometer radius. If you are ever in Tuscany, you have to visit: Accademia del Buon Gusto (accademiadelbuongusto.com)

Soooo....This has probably been our best kept secret of 2016. But we are ready to spill the beans. We're officially, honestly, truly releasing our very own cookbook!! Yes, ideally we should be consuming pesticide-free food but things can get pretty pricey and it's not always possible, even for us. It's okay if you don't buy organic. Have you heard of the dirty 12/clean 15? Aim to use these lists as a guide to reduce pesticide exposure, anddd support your local farmers market! Many times, farmers can't afford to get the organic certification but don't use pesticides on their farm. Talk to the farmers at the market and ask them about their growing practices.

Black history month recipes continue! In case you missed it, we’re bringing you dishes inspired from the African Diaspora all this month. Today we’ve got this Jerk Tofu Scramble recipe, paired with collards & toast. 🤤 Jerk sauce is native to Jamaica, and is usually made w/ scotch bonnet peppers, allspice, cinnamon, scallions, nutmeg, thyme, & more! It is said to be created by escaped slaves who fled to the mountains, and would use a blend of spices to marinate & cook the game they hunted. The sauce is JAM PACKED with flavor and beautiful smells! We made our own rub, added it to this tofu scramble, and saved the rest for use in other recipes. Who loves jerk? Snatch this recipe on the blog & bio link! xoxo ✊🏾✊🏾✊🏾 🇯🇲 🇯🇲🇯🇲⠀

Eating out of pots & pans is life. Say hi to the best damn turmeric veg fried rice you ever did see. Aside from adding a pretty color, turmeric is rich in curcumin, which has been shown to have anti-carcinogenic, anti-inflammatory, & antibacterial effects. It’s an affordable spice that keeps well in the pantry. We love it in teas, smoothies, stews, & even on our face! I made a huge batch of the rice, used it for the stir fry and froze the rest. You can use it for quick meals when the fridge is running low. Catch this baby in the bio link! 😘😘

As a vegetarian, I’m constantly looking for ways to boost my protein intake after an intense weight training workout. Out of all the proteins that exist, eggs are actually the best source, according to the PDCAAS or Protein Digestibility Corrected Amino Acid Score (yes, there are actually people who have the job of breaking down proteins and ranking them according to their amino acid content and ratio). These egg tacos were oh-so-tasty and only took 5 minutes in total to make. At 21 grams of pro per serving, they’re literally PERFECT for helping your muscle fibers repair themselves after strength training. Recipe on the site. Link in the bio.

New Recipe Alert! Chickpea Gazpacho. Who said you couldn’t enjoy soup in the summer? This creamy Chickpea Gazpacho is a perfect light and refreshing summer appetizer. Since 2016 is the International Year of the Pulses, we decided to put a spin on a traditional Gazpacho and add chickpeas (aka garbanzo beans). Chickpeas (and all pulses for that matter — think black beans, lentils, dry peas and beans) contain a whopping 9 grams of protein per ½ cup. They are also jam packed with fiber, which studies suggest can help to lower cholesterol levels, keep you feeling full and prevent constipation. Have you taken the ‪

Trader Joes shopping day. Loveee going Friday right after work since I'm in a good mood that there are less crowds. And it eases the shopping anxiety you have when you wait until the end of the evening on Sunday. I bought enough for three meals and three hearty snacks for the week + a couple of treats. Also each meal includes one serving of veggies, protein and carbs. Total spent is $60. I probably spend a total of 20 to 25 minutes cooking meals/prepping snacks per day, IF that. Save way more time eating like this (don't get me wrong, i like going out too) than when I used to just wing it every day. How much do you guys spend? What's in your cart?

One of the most frequent questions we get asked as Registered Dietitians is what to eat BEFORE a workout (we are actually planning a whole podcast on this, so stay tuned). I always tell my clients that it's good to get a mixture of carbs (for energy) and a bit of protein (for muscle growth). Perfect example: half an apple 🍎 and a few nuts 🥜. I love these 100 calorie snack packs from @bluediamond because they're the perfect portion for before a workout. You can also have this with a small tangerine 🍊 or half of a banana 🍌. What about you? What pre-workout snack makes you feel your best in the gym? We know everyone's body has different needs, so share what optimizes your workout performance! 💪

How do you sweeten your coffee? Today on the blog...artificial sugars! Are they safe, should you consume them, what does the science have to say, & more! These are also known as the splendas, sweetnlows, & equals. Also known as what sweetens a lot of those diet drinks. Many people use them in an effort to cut back on calories. They’re also popular among people with diabetes. Read in on what we have to say about them in the bio link! Take aways? Generally we don’t recommend them (for many reasons) and prefer to use the real thing. However, there may be a place for them for someone, who for example, has uncontrolled diabetes. Tune in to read the full scoop!

Face mask all ready to go! Tap if you struggle to keep your skin hydrated during the winter months. We teamed up with our friends at @mightieskiwi to bring you this hydrating Kiwi Avocado Honey face mask that will help to soothe that dry skin during the this time of the year. 》The nice thing about Mighties is that they are available year-around, with the California season spanning from November through April. 》If you make this face mask, don't be surprised if you actually find yourself EATING the leftovers LOLOL. This mask smells as good as it tastes -- and it's completely edible. If you give this dry skin remedy a try, make sure to let us know how it goes. 》Who has other recipes for alleviating winter skin blues?

Recipe:
1 kiwi
1/4 cup of greek yogurt
1/4 avocado
1 teaspoon of honey

Blend all ingredients in a food processor. Apply a layer to the face for 10 minutes. Rinse with a hydrating cleanser and warm water, then you are good to go!

Sunday’s are for DIY. Making these sugar scrubs to gift for the holidays 🎁 My place smells divine. Who here makes their own skin products? Share your fave simple recipes 👇🏽Here’s mine:
1/3 cup total of brown & granulated sugar (mixed)
2 1/2 tablespoons olive oil
9 drops of your fave essential oil
...add the sugar to small jars, drizzle the oil, add the essential oils, mix with a spoon, cover and let sit. That’s it! So simple, thoughtful, and delicious. Enjoy the rest of the Sunday 😘

New podcast alert!🚨 Why We Stopped Promoting Weight Loss. We get hit up so many times from people who want to live healthier, and somehow the focus always goes to weight. Studies after studies are showing that weight is NOT an indicator of good health, and that this focus on weight loss can actually lead to negative health outcomes. ————————🌸
We’re not all going to be a size 4, and we shouldn’t be. Research shows that significant weight loss doesn’t yield results long term. Most people gain the weight back, and unfortunately, in an attempt to lose weight, cycle into dieting and disordered eating. ————————🌸
The GOOD news is that you can start living your best life right NOW, at whatever size you are. Listen in bio link to hear more about why we stopped promoting weight loss (yes, we used to think weight loss was important too) and how we shifted towards a healthier, more balanced and weight inclusive approach. Xoxoxo 💃🏽💃🏽💃🏽

Just created a batch of this skin oil for joint pain and skin ailments- which I've been struggling with for the past few months. It's made with 1 tbsp of tea tree oil + 1 tbsp of eucalyptus oil diluted in 1/4 c olive oil. Tea tree oil has anti-bacterial/fungal properties and does wonders for the skin. Eucalyptus is in the same category + has been shown to help with pain and inflammation. Give it a try if you're looking for some alternative therapies or if you just wanna smell amazing ♡

We've got you covered with these 3 Immune Boosting Fall Tonics! As the months get cooler, I prefer juices vs smoothies. I find them more comforting. One big beef many dietitians have w/ juices is that they're usually high in sugar, since it takes quite a bit of fruit to make a decent cup of juice. This is a valid concern if you're making fruit-based juices. The 3 tonics we made have a good balance of veg + fruit with each juice having no more than 2 servings of carbs. They also contain seasonal ingredients like ginger, which is particularly wonderful during these cooler months. Recipes on the site! Have a lovely Tuesday 😘🥕🥕💃🏾

Plant based Monday has arrived and we’re featuring a fall classic: broccoli! This cruciferous veg is packed with over 💯 % of your vitamin c & k daily needs in just one cup! The leaves are also edible and can be prepared similar to collards. What I like to do during the colder months is stock up on broccoli before it’s gone at the markets, blanch em & throw them in the freezer. Who else loves this classic veg?
